title: Dynamic system and Autofill are extremly stupid, now......Upvote this, or i vote for Hillary today.
body: Come on! Give me a big Thumb-up !

replies.body:
Sigh, to be in a world where our options for president is Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump... 

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-FyC9SecHyUE/U0CF9vSCnPI/AAAAAAAAHuI/Sb80M2XK46Y/s1600/i-dont-want-to-live-on-this-planet-anymore-futurama-funny-wallpaper-1920x1200.png

??? she has yet to win the nomination and is still tied more or less in delegates with bernie, news agencies that work for hillary are just trying to call it early so people give up, heck in the history of debates this is actually the first time anyone has been so arrogant to pull that crap.

Well thank god it's not decided yet, but it really feels like that's what we will end up with come election (likely due to control over news agencies like you said). I'm all for our first female president, just not her being Hillary and Trump... well... when North Korea calls you a "wise leader", I think you might be sending the wrong message .__.

> [{quoted}](name=Blue Moon Wolf,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=JatBenW6,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T03:42:56.327+0000)

> Well thank god it's not decided yet, but it really feels like that's what we will end up with come election (likely due to control over news agencies like you said). I'm all for our first female president, just not her being Hillary and Trump... well... when North Korea calls you a "wise leader", I think you might be sending the wrong message .__.

sauce?
Clinton just got enough delegates for the nomination today. I'm not a fan of Bernie but at least he's honest about what he stands for unlike that snake. Sadly our only hope now is indictment.
Wrong (unless California finished voting) super delegates don't count yet. The news media is trying to supress the votes to keep Bernie from winning

The fact that Bernie Sanders is/was even considered a viable candidate is actually scary. Bernie Sanders is actually a socialist and its funny how little Americans know about history or they would be dead scared of socialism. Does nobody know anything about cold-war Russia?? They just want the "free money" Bernie Sanders promises with no care in the world of the actual country they are living in. Its disgusting.

The United States of America is and has been a **_SOCIALIST DEMOCRACY_** and this is what Bernie is. This is not to be confused with Socialism, please do not misinform yourself by thinking you know information that you don't.

Bernie self identifies as a Democratic Socialist. Which means he is in-fact a socialist. The difference between a socialist democrat and a democratic socialist is that the later is in favor of ending capitalism and putting all big businesses in the hands of the proletarians. How can you tell me that Bernie is not a socialist when even he says that he is.
Last time I checked, the only President to be elected for 4 terms was also called a socialist.

Different times my friend. I'm serious please read about Karl Marx and socialism, and if you have any common sense you'll be terrified. You have to understand that "free college," is impossible, 15$ an hour minimum wage is impossible, and free healthcare turns healthcare to shit. The reason hospitals are so good right now is because of capitalist competition. The post office? It was trash until businesses came in and added capitalist competition. I've read communist manifesto and researched a lot about socialism, its scary stuff used to control ignorant citizens that lack proper education. That fits perfectly in the US right now, you would be surprised how many people don't know what two countries border the US.

>"The goal of socialism is communism" -Vladimir Lenin.

Also my original post still stand. Bernie is a socialist.

Different times, same ole fear tactics used. You act as if Karl Marx was after FDR anyway lmfao. The things you say are "impossible" are actually not impossible. "Free" college is done elsewhere, and works. Public healthcare is done elsewhere, and works. You talk about how great American healthcare is....LOL. Do you even work in the healthcare field? Because I do. It's the furthest thing from "so good". 

>I've read communist manifesto and researched a lot about socialism, its scary stuff used to control ignorant citizens that lack proper education. That fits perfectly in the US right now, you would be surprised how many people don't know what two countries border the US.

You used the word right there. Scary. It's fear tactics. Nothing more. In hopes that the average American isn't intelligent enough to understand these things. Again, everyone wanted to cry socialism when FDR enacted a minimum wage (Which by the way, was defined as the minimum wage you can make a decent living. Not "a no skill job for high school kids."). You seem to insinuate that those people are voting for Sanders, yet poll numbers show by and large Trump supports are the most uneducated voters.

It's very simple. You outsource all your decent paying jobs in order to benefit the pockets of the 1%, you will have a lot of poor people. People want to bitch about how "lazy" the new generation is. Let's take the same low skill working now vs earlier. You used to be able to get outta high school and go get a good paying job at the factory. But then, all these innovators' kids started inheriting their companies. They lost all the principles the company was founded on and "Oh look, I can make $10 mil a year instead of $8 mil by shipping my jobs to Mexico! Better bribe congress to enact all this legislature to enable me to do so." So now, those SAME EXACT low skill workers get starvation wages at Walmart and McDonald's.

Pretty much the only way to get a decent living in this country is through education. Higher education isn't for everyone. And it shouldn't have to be. But then, republicans want to get confused as to why they lose the general election when they put up a candidate that, when asked about his policies decreasing government funding of education to save a couple cents (literally) off your paycheck, says, "just borrow money from your parents." LOL. Sorry Romney, not all of us can do so. Had people like Romney or Trump been president while I was applying for college, I would not have the opportunity to be a pharmacist. Just because of the family I was born to. That is not "capitalism". Just like having a decent minimum wage isn't socialism.

Teddy and FDR have to be rolling in their graves right now.

Trickle down economics don't work. Never have, never will.

>Bernie is a socialist.

Really? Where has Bernie suggested taking everything in the country and dividing it up equally among each citizen? That's what socialism is. But sure, keep believing the hype buzzwords Faux News will throw at you.

Bernie sanders grew up in a kibootz. A kibootz id a fully fledged communist comunity. He also self identifies during many of his speaches as a "democratic socialist."

Also free healthcare is always awful. And look at any country with "free" college and check their GDP.
Hillaryous post, it even got to be the top, it must be a big Trump for you.

Thank god, I thought I was the only one who's disgusted by Hillary.

But politics aside, autofill is insanely stupid and essentially defeats the purpose of the NCS upgrade. Even though it's not enabled on my tier I feel it's only a matter of time until it trickles down.
About 60% of the US is disgusted by Hillary for one reason or another.
I guess that is why Trump is so popular.
Oh no, I'm disgusted by him too.
I'm not disgusted by Trump. I'm disgusted by Hillary. I'm *terrified* of Trump.

> [{quoted}](name=Bermeme Sanders,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=JatBenW6,comment-id=00040000000200000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T03:23:20.595+0000)
>
> I'm not disgusted by Trump. I'm disgusted by Hillary. I'm *terrified* of Trump.

Very much this. Hillary has my vote, because I am scared shitless of what America would become under president Trump.
You're scared of America becoming great?

> [{quoted}](name=Billy VoHagen,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=JatBenW6,comment-id=0004000000020000000000010000,timestamp=2016-06-08T20:09:28.599+0000)
>
> You're scared of America becoming great?

No. I'm scared of America being **made** great.

Becoming is something that happens to you. Making is much more proactive.

And, at the risk of invoking [Gowin's law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Godwin%27s_law), when you're being proactive about increasing the power of your country and part of that plan involves deporting a group of people based on their heritage... yes, that's fucking terrifying.

I want to see America become a great democracy.
I don't want to see Trump make it into a great fascism.

How difficult is it to understand that they're not being deported because of their heritage? It's because they're in this country **ILLEGALLY**.

Let me repeat that, because this is something that a lot of people like to avoid when they discuss this, **ILLEGAL**.

As in, they broke the law to be here.

> [{quoted}](name=Billy VoHagen,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=JatBenW6,comment-id=000400000002000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-08T20:37:32.496+0000)

> 
> As in, they broke the law to be here.

This bothers me so much. White people are always complaining that everything is racist as if their still embarrassed of their ancestors. They twist things like this into racial issues. Barrack _Hussein_ Obama does this with almost every single issue that arrises. (Esp. in the middle east.)
It's always people complaining that white men are racist. Apparently, no one else can be racist in this society.
Trump and Hillary are the 2 most hated candidates in US history .-.
You know very little about history if you think that is true.

As I like to put it:

Trump will bring us into the Second American Civil War or World War 3

Hillary will sell our country out from under us.

Both of them should be nowhere near D.C. much less the Oval Office.
That's actually about right statistically speaking on her approval rating

http://elections.huffingtonpost.com/pollster/hillary-clinton-favorable-rating

I thumbs'd down because even if Hillary was a literal brown paper sack full of dogshit, she'd still be better than Trump, and if your not voting Hillary, you're probably voting Trump. Say no to the candidate who represents the KKK, Putin, and Kim Jong Un's ineterests(literally that's who you're siding with).
Hillary represents those people as well though? she is just better at hiding it.

If I was a US citizen, I would not vote for either of them because I believe you should always vote FOR someone, not against them. If I don't see a candidate I like, I just wouldn't vote. I understand why many would disagree, though.

>Give me a big Trump-up

FTFY
please no... lol

How can you trust the wife of Bill Clinton who made the worst trade agreement in the history of the U.S. 
>NAFTA.
 (Look it up if you don't know about it.)

Because of NAFTA, American workers are now forced to compete directly with Mexican workers who, on average, make just $3 per hour. Their American counterparts make $18 per hour. Why would any manufacturer want to produce here in America and pay $18-20 per hour when the same product can be produced right across the border in Mexico for just $3 per hour and then shipped back to the U.S. duty- and restriction-free?
Why are you so worried about shitty jobs Mexicans can do for 3 bucks a hour. Get a degree, and get a job a Mexican cant do for 3$ per hour.
Oh, I don't know, because over a million jobs have gone to Mexico because of it?
then dont buy shit made in mexico
Then buy shit from where? China? Whats the difference its still outside of America.
No buy goods only made in America obviously.
AKA say goodbye to 90% of everything sold in every store ever.
